item.title: on the shortness of life
item.description: It is not that we have so little time but that we lose so much. … The life we receive is not short but we make it so; we are not ill provided but use what we have wastefully. Life can only be understood backwards; but it must be lived forwards. – Soren Kierkegaard [Man] is a specific organism of a specific nature that requires specific actions to sustain his life.
